Package stocker.model

Class ChartWatchItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • stocker.model.WatchItem
      • stocker.model.ChartWatchItem
  • public class ChartWatchItem
extends WatchItem
    Represents an item (a stock, for instance) which is meant to be drawn as a chart. ChartWatchItems are mainly used for transfer of chart-relevant data between the data manager and the chart panel. The chart panel then uses its own data format to store the data.
    Author:
    Marc S. Schneider

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChartWatchItem

        public ChartWatchItem​(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a new ChartWatchItem referring to the data with the provided key. The chart interval will be set to 1 day and the start end end time to zero (needs to be set properly later).
        Parameters:
        key - the ticker symbol of the item to be watched
        name - the descriptive name of the item to be watched

      • ChartWatchItem

        public ChartWatchItem​(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      EChartInterval interval)
        Constructs a new ChartWatchItem referring to the data with the provided key.
        Parameters:
        key - the ticker symbol of the item to be watched
        name - the descriptive name of the item to be watched
        interval - the EChartInterval that this chart should have

    • Method Detail

      • getInterval

        public EChartInterval getInterval()
        Get the EChartInterval that this ChartWatchItem currently contains.
        Returns:
        the current EChartInterval

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval​(EChartInterval interval)
        Set the EChartInterval that this ChartWatchItem should contain from now on.
        Parameters:
        interval - the new EChartInterval

        public long getStartTime()
        Get the start time for the data to be contained in a chart for this item.

      • setCandles

        public void setCandles​(java.util.LinkedList<Candle> candles,
                       EChartInterval interval)
        Set the data candles for this ChartWatchItem according to the parameters.
        Parameters:
        candles - a LinkedList of candles that represent the data of this item
        interval - the EChartInterval that this chart should have

      • getCandles

        public java.util.LinkedList<Candle> getCandles()
        Get the list of data candles that is currently assigned to this item.
        Returns:
        the current LinkedList of data candles

      • appendValues

        public void appendValues​(long time,
                         double low,
                         double high,
                         double open,
                         double close)
        Append a new data candle according to the parameters to the list of candles and remove the first (oldest) one.
        Parameters:
        time - the unix timestamp at which the data are given
        low - the lowest price during the period
        high - the highest price during the period
        open - the opening price (at the begin of the period)
        close - the closing price (at the end of the period)
